title: Slow down TrackTitleMarquee default scroll speed

requirements.summary: Reduce the default TrackTitleMarquee scroll speed so the right-to-left marquee feels less rushed everywhere it is used.
acceptanceCriteria: The default `speedPxPerSecond` value in `frontend/src/components/player/TrackTitleMarquee.tsx` is reduced from the current value (200) to a slower value.

In both the Mini Player (`frontend/src/components/player/MiniPlayer.tsx`) and Now Playing screen (`frontend/src/screens/NowPlayingScreen.tsx`), the visible marquee scrolls right-to-left at the new slower speed without requiring any prop changes where `TrackTitleMarquee` is used.

The computed marquee animation duration increases accordingly (duration is derived from distance / speed), and remains clamped within the existing 3–30 seconds bounds in `frontend/src/hooks/useMarqueeMeasurements.ts`.
Reduced-motion behavior and pause-on-interaction behavior continue to work as before (no regression).

file_operations.description: Reduce the component’s default `speedPxPerSecond` (currently 200) to a slightly slower value (e.g., 160) so all existing usages (including MiniPlayer and NowPlayingScreen) automatically scroll more slowly without changing any call sites; keep reduced-motion and pause-on-interaction logic unchanged.

Align the hook’s default `speedPxPerSecond` with the new slower baseline (to keep behavior consistent if the hook is ever used without an explicit speed), ensuring the duration calculation still uses distance/speed and remains clamped to the existing 3–30 seconds bounds.
